summary: Level 1 Female Imperial based on NPC Vex of the Thieves Guild. Vex now also available as preset in \"ESP - Expanded Skyrim Presets\", along with 300+ other NPCs.
descriptionHtml:
Name: Val - Twin Sister of Vex
Version: 1.0
Date: 03-03-2012
Category: Saved games
Requirements: None
Author(s): c_striker
Source: 


[color=#00FF00] UPDATE:[/color] I have now released a new mod, \"ESP - Expanded Skyrim Presets\", which makes Vex (along with 300+ other NPCs) available to play as a preset in the character creation menu. If you\'d prefer the preset version, which allows you to customize the character or to convert your existing character via the showracemenu console command, you can find the new mod [color=yellow] [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=15963&tab=3&navtag=/modules/comments/comments_ajax.php?tid=658266|:|fid=15963] here[/color][/url].


Description
===========
This is a savegame of my female imperial character Val, who is an identical twin of the NPC Vex.
I thought Vex was the hottest looking NPC in the game and decided to replicate her as a player character. I am making her available in case anyone else feels likewise but doesn\'t want to go through the tedious process of duplicating her chargen settings.

The NPC Vex is a member of the Thieves Guild and can be found hanging out in the Ragged Flagon in Riften. If you haven\'t already done so I suggest you go check her out. If you find your current Vex attractive then you will find Val attractive (after all, they are identical twins).
 
If you want her to look exactly like the screenshots then you will need to use the same mods I do. But before you go to that trouble, make sure you take a look at your in-game Vex. You might like her looks better, in which case you won\'t need any other mods.

Regardless of mod choice, Val and Vex should look identical (unless you previously used an NPC editor to change Vex, in which case all bets are off).

I have included two save files. One is inside Helgen Keep (just before drawbridge - too late to kill some folks but not too late to track back in case you think I missed some loot). The second is just outside the cave after escaping Helgen Keep.

If you like my work, please feel free to check out my other mods:
* \"Astrid and Karliah\": http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/download.php?id=50370
* \"Diverse Female Housecarls\": http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/download.php?id=49520
* \"Hroki and Jordis\": http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/download.php?id=50842
* \"Lisette and Muiri\": http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/download.php?id=51033


Mods used in the screenshots
============================
Face:
* \"Better Females by Bella\": http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/download.php?id=9747 (\"No make up just improved textures\" version)
* \"Beauty Faces by NecKros\": http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/download.php?id=6226 (specular map only)
* \"No More Blocky Faces\" by Xenius: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/download.php?id=13714 (I use version 1.3)
I use a blend of these three mods. Install No More Blocky Faces first, then Bella\'s mod, then take only the specular map (femalehead_s.dds) from the NecKros mod and use it to replace the one from Bella.
The specular map is located in the following folder: textures\\actors\\character\\female
Eyes:
* \"Natural Eyes\" by nevenbridge: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/download.php?id=11110
Hair:
* \"Straight hair retexture\" by navetsea: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/download.php?id=13007


Install
=======
Manual install
--------------
1. Extract the files of this mod to a temporary location (you can use 7zip: http://www.7-zip.org, to unzip them) and check the folder structure.
2. Copy the .ess files to your saved games folder, typically: \\My Games\\Skyrim\\Saves
3. Launch Skyrim and load your saved game of choice. 


Incompatibility
===============
None.


History
=======
1.0, 03-03-2012 - Initial release.


Contact
=======
You can contact me by leaving a comment at the mod\'s thread or find me on the nexus as c_striker (user ID = 955515).


Credits
=======
Thanks to Bethesda for creating Skyrim and for creating the fetching NPC upon which Val is based.
Thanks to LHammonds for the Readme Generator this file was based on: http://hammondslegacy.com/obmm/tools_readme_generator1.asp
Thanks to the modders mentioned above for their efforts and improvements to the game.
Thanks to Nexus and the modding community for the access, tools and resources.


Tools Used
==========
7zip - http://www.7-zip.org/
Readme Generator - http://lhammonds.game-host.org/obmm/tools_readme_generator1.asp


Licensing/Legal
===============
Feel free to use this character in your own mod, but please give credit to me and (more importantly) Bethesda if you distribute.
author: c_striker
